CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON and QUANTITY others brought an action against the applicant and CARDINAL further respondents before the Budapest IV / XV District Court , seeking title to , and termination of , co - ownership . Several respondents lived abroad , causing certain difficulties in summoning them .
CARDINAL . ORG held CARDINAL hearings DATE and DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the proceedings were stayed on account of the death of respondent ORG The applicant , on whom this was legally incumbent , invited the successors to join the proceedings on DATE .
CARDINAL . DATE and CARDINAL DATE CARDINAL further hearings were held . A partial judgment was delivered on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing and , by its order of CARDINAL DATE , quashed the partial judgment and remitted the case to the first instance .
CARDINAL . In the resumed proceedings , CARDINAL hearings were held and a partial judgment was delivered on DATE .
CARDINAL . The proceedings continued on appeal before ORG , acting as a second - instance court . This court adopted a final partial decision on DATE .
CARDINAL . As to the remainder , it appears from the documents in the case file that the proceedings are still pending .
